courses.name: Computer Graphics
details: A comprehensive introduction to computer graphics modeling, animation, and rendering.
As part of the course, I implemented loop subdivision and created both a raytracer and a physics simulator.

courses.name: Introduction to Robotics
details: An overview of robotics, with topics such as vision, motion planning, and forward and inverse kinematics.

As part of a team of 3, I used a Lego NXT kit to solve problems like Dead Reckoning, Trajectory Following, and Urban Search and Rescue (USAR). My team won both competitions held in our semester - USAR and the student-defined Predator and Prey competition.

courses.name: Great Theoretical Ideas in Computer Science
details: A course about how to use theoretical ideas to formulate and solve problems in computer science, integrating mathematical material with general problem solving techniques and computer science applications.
Examples are drawn from algorithms, complexity theory, game theory, probability theory, graph theory, automata theory, algebra, cryptography, and combinatorics.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Systems
details: A programmer's view of how computer systems operate. Topics include machine-level code, memory organization, networking technology, and concurrency.
As part of the course, I created a cache simulator, a shell, a multi-threaded proxy server, and my own implementation of malloc.

courses.name: Parallel and Sequential Data Structures and Algorithms
details: A course which teaches students about how to design, analyze, and program algorithms and data structures.
The course emphasizes parallel algorithms and analysis, and how sequential algorithms can be considered a special case.

courses.name: Principles of Functional Programming
details: An introduction to programming focused on the concepts of function and type. A major them is the interplay between inductive types, recursive functions, and proof by structrual induction.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Programming and Computer Science
details: A fast-paced technical introduction to the fundamentals of computer science.
